docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. prices for the world's 20 top-selling medicines are, on average, three times higher than in Britain, according to an analysis carried out for Reuters.

docs.lead_paragraph: The latest on the flooding from a rainstorm that pounded South Carolina (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: Governor: South Carolina Moving Into Recovery
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Governor: South Carolina Moving Into Recovery

docs.snippet: The latest on the flooding from a rainstorm that pounded South Carolina (all times local):

docs.lead_paragraph: As the worst of the floodwaters that roared through South Carolina washed out to sea, Gov. Nikki Haley and other officials said Monday it is time to start recovering instead of reacting to the ongoing emergency.

headline.main: Rivers Crest, I-95 Opens as South Carolina Turns to Recovery
headline.print_headline: Rivers Crest, I-95 Opens as South Carolina Turns to Recovery

docs.snippet: As the worst of the floodwaters that roared through South Carolina washed out to sea, Gov. Nikki Haley and other officials said Monday it is time to start recovering instead of reacting to the ongoing emergency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Georgia Healthcare Group Plc, a unit of Bank of Georgia Holdings Plc, said it intended to raise $100 million (65 million pounds) via an initial public offering in London, as investor appetite for health-related offerings grows.

headline.main: Bank of Georgia's Healthcare Unit Plans London Debut
headline.print_headline: Bank of Georgia's Healthcare Unit Plans London Debut

docs.lead_paragraph: A rash of hacking attacks on U.S. companies over the past two years has prompted insurers to massively increase cyber premiums for some companies, leaving firms that are perceived to be a  high risk scrambling for cover.

headline.main: Cyber Insurance Premiums Rocket After High-Profile Attacks
headline.print_headline: Cyber Insurance Premiums Rocket After High-Profile Attacks

docs.snippet: A rash of hacking attacks on U.S. companies over the past two years has prompted insurers to massively increase cyber premiums for some companies, leaving firms that are perceived to be a  high risk scrambling for cover.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mississippi, which has some of the highest rates of attrition from the insurance marketplace this year, is symbolic of the challenge facing the exchanges: keeping the customers they have.

headline.main: Insurance Dropouts Present a Challenge for Health Law
headline.print_headline: Insurance Dropouts Present a Challenge for Health Law

docs.abstract: Public health insurance exchanges are facing problem of retaining customers, even as health care providers and groups focused on enrolling people in insurance plans are gearing up for new Affordable Care Act sign-up period, which begins in November; retaining health insurance is particularly difficult for poorer Americans in states like Mississippi, one of 20 in which lawmakers did not expand Medicaid coverage; experts and enrollment groups say many of those who have dropped their insurance have done so due to confusion.
docs.snippet: Mississippi, which has some of the highest rates of attrition from the insurance marketplace this year, is symbolic of the challenge facing the exchanges: keeping the customers they have.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, the major candidates for president, have already promised different approaches.

headline.main: A Likely Debate Highlight: Democrats’ Distance From Obama
headline.print_headline: Obama Legacy Part of Debate for Democrats

docs.abstract: Question of Pres Obama's legacy and how much any Democratic successor should associate themselves with it will be backdrop for upcoming Democratic presidential primary debate; front-runners Hillary Rodham Clinton and Sen Bernie Sanders have both promised different approaches from Obama, indication of how Democratic Party has changed in seven years since he became its standard-bearer.
docs.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Senator Bernie Sanders, the major candidates for president, have already promised different approaches.

docs.lead_paragraph: The couple were introduced by the groom’s stepsister.
docs.snippet: The couple were introduced by the groom’s stepsister.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress needs to curb the wacky up-and-down movements of premiums and deductibles.

headline.main: The Unlucky Millions Paying More for Medicare
headline.print_headline: The Unlucky Millions Paying More for Medicare

docs.abstract: Editorial implores Congress to address fluctuations in Medicare premiums and deductibles over 2016-17 that will harm low- and middle-income recipients.
docs.snippet: Congress needs to curb the wacky up-and-down movements of premiums and deductibles.
